para.emph: Tie Rod And Steering Arm Change

geninfo.para: Due to increased market demand, tie rod and steering arms are being resourced. In addition, Rockwell has taken advantage of this resourcing to improve the product by changing the key design in the taper joint of all non-driving front axle tie rod and steering arms.
The new key and key seat are a Woodruff shape as opposed to the old square key design. Refer to Figure 1.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Tie Rod and Steering Arm Key Change

geninfo.para: The new Woodruff design is easier to assemble because it does not slide up or down the slot.

Top level specifications will not change. Tie rod and steering arm part numbers will not change. Key part numbers will change. As this will be a running change, the Bill of Material will indicate Woodruff or square key design.
This change will be implemented on a running change basis beginning in April 1995. FF and FG series axle tie rod arms will be changed first.

Rockwell recommends the appropriate key be assembled into the appropriate arm. Rockwell recommends arms with Woodruff seat be assembled exclusively with Woodruff keys. Conversely, arms with square seat are to be assembled only with square keys.
Rockwell does not recommend assembly of Woodruff keys into square arm seats. Square keys are not to be assembled into arms with the Woodruff key seat.
Loose arm shipments for production assembly with Woodruff keys will be shipped with appropriate keys.
This tie rod and steering arm change does not affect the steering knuckle.

Service replacement square and Woodruff keys will be available individually. Tie rod and steering arms will be sold as a kit that includes the appropriate key. All components will be available through Rockwell Aftermarket Service channels at Florence, KY and Brampton, Ontario.
If you have any questions. please contact your Rockwell account representative.
